name: Weaving

pages.text: $(thing)Weaving$() is the process of combining different kinds of string into $(thing)Cloth$(). While the last step of weaving is done in a $(thing)Loom$(), some cloths such as $(thing)Wool$(), obtained from $(l:mechanics/animal_husbandry#wooly_animals)Wooly Animals$(), requires a $(thing)Spindle$() to obtain $(thing)Wool Yarn$() in order to be woven.
The $(thing)Unfired Spindle Head$() is knapped from clay. It can then be $(l:mechanics/heating)fired$() to make a $(thing)Spindle Head$(). To complete the spindle, craft it with a $(thing)Stick$().
Crafting $(thing)Wool$() with a Spindle yields $(thing)Wool Yarn$().
The loom is crafted from just $(thing)Lumber$() and a $(thing)Stick$().

The recipe for $(thing)Wool Cloth$() takes 16 $(thing)Wool Yarn$(). Adding to the loom is done with $(item)$(k:key.use)$(). Then, hold down $(item)$(k:key.use)$() to begin working the loom. When it is done, press $(item)$(k:key.use)$() to retrieve the item.
The stages of the loom working.
$(thing)Wool Cloth$() can be re-woven into $(thing)Wool Blocks$(). Wool blocks can be $(l:mechanics/dye)dyed$().
$(thing)Silk Cloth$() can be made in the loom out of $(thing)String$(). It can be used as a wool cloth substitute in some cases.
$(thing)Burlap Cloth$() does not have a use, but it can be made from $(l:mechanics/crops#jute)Jute Fiber$().
